meanings.definition: Reorganized: to organize again in a different way
meanings.sent1: After the chaos, she reorged her desk to be more efficient.
meanings.sent2: The company reorged its departments to improve communication.
meanings.sent3: The messy closet begged to be reorged, tired of the clutter.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts reorged themselves into a clear plan for the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces reorged into a beautiful picture before her eyes.

meanings.definition: Reorging: the act of organizing again in a different way
meanings.sent1: His reorging of the files made finding documents much easier.
meanings.sent2: The reorging of the schedule caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent3: The reorging of the party decorations turned into a fun game.
meanings.sent4: Her reorging of the garden layout was like creating a new world.
meanings.sent5: The reorging of the bookshelves brought a sense of order to the room.

meanings.definition: Reorgs: instances of organizing again in a different way
meanings.sent1: The office manager kept track of all the reorgs happening in the company.
meanings.sent2: Multiple reorgs within the project caused delays in completion.
meanings.sent3: The reorgs of the seating arrangement at the event led to musical chairs.
meanings.sent4: The constant reorgs of the store layout confused the regular customers.
meanings.sent5: The reorgs of the city's traffic system aimed to reduce congestion.
